prompt.content: In the card game Flesh and Blood, what does the card Awakening Bellow (Red) do? Make sure to include information when appropriate for the class, card type, cost, pitch, defence, power, and any abilities.

data.sampled:
Awakening Bellow (Red) is a card in the brute class of Flesh and Blood. It is an attack action card with a cost of 2 resources and a pitch value of 2. The card has a power of 4 and a defence value of 0.

The ability of Awakening Bellow (Red) is that it gains +1 power for each card in the defending hero's hand. Additionally, if the attack deals 4 or more damage, the defending hero discards a card at random from their hand.

Overall, Awakening Bellow (Red) is a powerful attack card that can deal significant damage and disrupt the defending hero's hand. It is particularly effective against heroes who rely on having a large hand size for their strategy.

prompt.content: In the card game Flesh and Blood, what does the card Ancestral Empowerment do? Make sure to include information when appropriate for the class, card type, cost, pitch, defence, power, and any abilities.

data.sampled:
Ancestral Empowerment is a generic action card in Flesh and Blood. It costs 1 resource point to play and has a pitch value of 2. The card has no defence value and no power value.

When played, Ancestral Empowerment allows the player to draw two cards from their deck. If the player's hero is a Runeblade, they may also reveal a Runeblade card from their hand and put it on top of their deck.

This card is useful for players who want to quickly cycle through their deck and find the cards they need to win the game. It is especially useful for Runeblade heroes, who can use it to set up their next turn by putting a powerful Runeblade card on top of their deck.

prompt.content: In the card game Flesh and Blood, what does the card Alpha Rampage do? Make sure to include information when appropriate for the class, card type, cost, pitch, defence, power, and any abilities.

data.sampled:
Alpha Rampage is a generic attack action card in Flesh and Blood. It has a cost of 3 resources and requires 2 cards of any one color to pitch. The card has a base power of 6 and no defense value.

The card also has an ability that reads: "If Alpha Rampage hits, put it on the bottom of your deck."

This means that if the attack successfully hits the opponent, the card is not discarded but instead placed at the bottom of the player's deck, allowing them to potentially draw it again later in the game.

Alpha Rampage can be used by any hero class in Flesh and Blood, making it a versatile card in many different decks. Its high power and ability to potentially be reused make it a valuable addition to any aggressive strategy.

prompt.content: In the card game Flesh and Blood, what does the card Awakening Bellow (Yellow) do? Make sure to include information when appropriate for the class, card type, cost, pitch, defence, power, and any abilities.

data.sampled:
Awakening Bellow (Yellow) is a card in the Guardian class of Flesh and Blood. It is an attack action card with a cost of 2 resources and a pitch value of 2 yellow. It has a base power of 4 and a base defence of 1.

The card also has an ability that reads: "If Awakening Bellow hits a hero, they can't play attack action cards with [Power] less than Awakening Bellow's [Power] during their next turn."

This means that if the attack successfully hits the opponent's hero, they will be restricted from playing any attack action cards with a power less than 4 during their next turn. This can be a powerful tool for controlling the opponent's options and limiting their ability to retaliate.

Overall, Awakening Bellow (Yellow) is a useful card for Guardian players looking to disrupt their opponent's strategy and gain an advantage in combat.

prompt.content: In the card game Flesh and Blood, what does the card Anothos do? Make sure to include information when appropriate for the class, card type, cost, pitch, defence, power, and any abilities.

data.sampled:
Anothos is a legendary brute class card in Flesh and Blood. It costs 6 resources to play and has a pitch value of 3. It has a defence value of 1 and a power of 8.

Anothos has two abilities. The first ability is called "Blood Debt." When Anothos enters the arena, the player who played it takes 1 damage for each card in their hand. This damage cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.

The second ability is called "Dominate." If Anothos hits an opposing hero, the player who played it gains control of the defending hero's next action. This means that the player can choose what the defending hero does on their next turn.

Overall, Anothos is a powerful card that can deal a lot of damage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. However, the Blood Debt ability means that the player who plays it must be careful not to take too much damage themselves.
